abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &NETlong; with &AWS;.

section.para: The code examples in this topic show you how to use the &NETlong; with &AWS;.

variablelist.para: The examples are divided into the following categories:

listitem.para: Code excerpts that show you how to call individual service functions.
Code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple functions within the same service.
Sample applications that work across multiple &AWS; services.

section.para: Examples

abstract.para: The following code examples show how to implement common scenarios and perform individual service actions by using &NET; with &AWS; services.

section.para: The following code examples show how to perform actions and implement common scenarios by using the &NETlong; with &AWS; services.
Actions are code excerpts that show you how to call individual service functions.
Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple functions within the same service.
Services

abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &NETlong; with &CW;.

section.para: The following code examples show you how to perform actions and implement common scenarios by using the &NETlong; with &CW;.
Actions are code excerpts that show you how to call individual &CW; functions.
Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple &CW; functions.
Each example includes a link to GitHub, where you can find instructions on how to set up and run the code in context.
The following code example shows how to delete &CWlong; alarms.
The following code example shows how to describe &CWlong; alarm history.
The following code example shows how to disable &CWlong; alarm actions.
The following code example shows how to enable &CWlong; alarm actions.
The following code example shows how to get &CWlong; dashboard details.
The following code example shows how to list &CWlong; dashboards.
The following code example shows how to list &CWlong; metrics.

abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &NETlong; with &CWL;.

Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple &CWL; functions.
Each example includes a link to GitHub, where you can find instructions on how to set up and run the code in context.

Each example includes a link to GitHub, where you can find instructions on how to set up and run the code in context.

info.title: Create a user and assume a role
info.titleabbrev: Create a user and assume a role

section.para: The following code example shows how to:

listitem.para: Create a user who has no permissions.
Create a role that grants permission to list &S3; buckets for the account.
Add a policy to let the user assume the role.
Assume the role and list &S3; buckets using temporary credentials.
Delete the policy, role, and user.

abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &NETlong; with &REK;.

section.para: The following code examples show you how to perform actions and implement common scenarios by using the &NETlong; with &REK;.
Actions are code excerpts that show you how to call individual &REK; functions.
Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple &REK; functions.
Each example includes a link to GitHub, where you can find instructions on how to set up and run the code in context.

info.title: Compare faces in an image against a reference image
info.titleabbrev: Compare faces in an image against a reference image

section.para: The following code example shows how to compare faces in an image against a reference image with &REK;.
For more information, see Comparing faces in images.
The following code example shows how to create an &REK; collection.
For more information, see Creating a collection.
The following code example shows how to delete an &REK; collection.
For more information, see Deleting a collection.
The following code example shows how to delete faces from an &REK; collection.
For more information, see Deleting faces from a collection.
The following code example shows how to describe an &REK; collection.
For more information, see Describing a collection.
The following code example shows how to detect faces in an image with &REK;.
For more information, see Detecting faces in an image.
The following code example shows how to detect labels in an image with &REK;.
For more information, see Detecting labels in an image.

info.title: Detect moderation labels in an image
info.titleabbrev: Detect moderation labels in an image

section.para: The following code example shows how to detect moderation labels in an image with &REK;. Moderation labels identify content that may be inappropriate for some audiences.
For more information, see Detecting inappropriate images.
The following code example shows how to detect text in an image with &REK;.
For more information, see Detecting text in an image.
The following code example shows how to get information about celebrities using &REK;.
The following code example shows how to index faces in an image and add them to an &REK; collection.
For more information, see Adding faces to a collection.
The following code example shows how to list &REK; collections.
For more information, see Listing collections.
The following code example shows how to list faces in an &REK; collection.
For more information, see Listing faces in a collection.
The following code example shows how to recognize celebrities in an image with &REK;.
For more information, see Recognizing celebrities in an image.

info.title: Search for faces in a collection
info.titleabbrev: Search for faces in a collection

section.para: The following code example shows how to search for faces in an &REK; collection that match another face from the collection.
For more information, see Searching for a face (face ID).

info.title: Search for faces in a collection compared to a reference image
info.titleabbrev: Search for faces in a collection compared to a reference image

section.para: The following code example shows how to search for faces in an &REK; collection compared to a reference image.
For more information, see Searching for a face (image).
